snippet: The annual Striped Bass and Bluefish Derby knits a Martha’s Vineyard town of 15,000 back together after its residents live among a summer population swelling to 105,000.
abstract: Annual Striped Bass and Bluefish Derby held in September in Edgartown, Mass, knits the Martha’s Vineyard town of 15,000 back together after its residents live among a summer population swelling to 105,000; 3,000 participants take part in one of the great saltwater fishing tournaments in the Northeast.
lead_paragraph: The annual Striped Bass and Bluefish Derby knits a Martha’s Vineyard town of 15,000 back together after its residents live among a summer population swelling to 105,000.

headline.seo: Martha’s Vineyard Crowds Leave, and the Fishing Gets Serious
headline.main: With the Crowds Gone, It’s Down to Serious Fishing
headline.print_headline: With the Crowds Gone, It’s Down to Serious Fishing
